items.sentence: It looks like Tom doesn\'t like you very much.
It looks like Tom won\'t go to Boston with us.
Tom didn\'t arrive until the concert was over.
Tom is quite capable of looking after himself.
Tom is standing over there near the fireplace.
Tom will do that later when he\'s not so busy.
Tom has been staying with his uncle in Boston.
Tom has been told to be here tomorrow at 2:30.
Tom has been very cooperative with the police.
I thought you were going to keep Tom occupied.
I told Tom not to do it, but he did it anyway.
Tom hasn\'t told Mary what\'s going to happen.
I almost wish I were going to Boston with you.
I really thought Tom wasn\'t going to do that.
Who did Tom think would pay his bills for him?
Who helped you pay for your college education?
We haven\'t had any problems with them at all.
Tom is playing poker with some of his friends.
Tom is standing on the other side of the wall.
Tom\'s dog suddenly took off after a squirrel.
